crazyballrun.game.graphics

Class GraphicsEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.graphics.GraphicsEngine

  • public class GraphicsEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    The GraphicsEngine is used for rendering 2D graphics. It also provides functionality to load and store different image-filetypes.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void end()
      Ends all threads the GraphicsEngine controls.
      Animation getAnimation(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String levelname, int size, int frequence)
      Loads an animation.
      java.awt.Frame getFrame()
      Returns the main frame for rendering/event-listening.

      Gets an image-reference from the hashmap.

      Searches for an image in the local level folder first.

      Copies an image of the image-hashtable.

      Provides access to the graphics engine.

      Gets an image-reference from the textures-hashmap.

      Loads a texture animation.
      void initialize()
      Initializes the graphics engine.
      void renderContinue()
      Continues rendering after a renderPause()-call.
      void renderGame()
      Forces the RenderThread to paint the current level's cameras' contents in addition to the current GUI-Frame (which might be an in-game-menu for example).
      void renderGUI()
      Forces the RenderThread to paint the current GUI-Frame and stop rendering the level's cameras.
      void renderPause()
      Pauses the rendering thread.
      void renderUpdate()
      Re-Initilizes the RenderThread, e.g. after changing screen resolution.
      void setAmpleState(int index)
      Defines the current state of the ample (-1 means no ample, 0 means red is active, 1 means red and yellow are active, 2 just yellow, 3 yellow and green and 4 just green).
      void setLevel(Level level)
      Gives a reference of the current level to the RenderThread.
      static java.awt.image.BufferedImage sLoadImage(java.lang.String path)
      Loads one image from a file.

      Loads all images of the given path into a hashmap .

      Creates and runs the rendering thread.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GraphicsEngine getInstance()
        Provides access to the graphics engine.
        Returns:
        a reference to the GraphicsEngine.

      • setAmpleState

        public void setAmpleState(int index)
        Defines the current state of the ample (-1 means no ample, 0 means red is active, 1 means red and yellow are active, 2 just yellow, 3 yellow and green and 4 just green).
        Parameters:
        index - ample index (state of the ample)

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(Level level)
        Gives a reference of the current level to the RenderThread.
        Parameters:
        level - level-reference

      • getFrame

        public java.awt.Frame getFrame()
        Returns the main frame for rendering/event-listening.
        Returns:
        the main frame.

      • sLoadImage

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage sLoadImage(java.lang.String path)
        Loads one image from a file.
        Parameters:
        path - absolute file path
        Returns:
        the reference to the Image-instance.

      • sLoadImages

        public static void sLoadImages(java.lang.String path,
               java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.awt.image.BufferedImage> output,
               boolean recursive)
        Loads all images of the given path into a hashmap .
        Parameters:
        path - folder-path containg the image-files
        output - hashmap for the output
        recursive - load images of the subfolders recursively

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the graphics engine.

      • start

        public void start()
        Creates and runs the rendering thread.

      • end

        public void end()
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Ends all threads the GraphicsEngine controls.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - interrupting the RenderThread might lead to errors

      • renderGame

        public void renderGame()
        Forces the RenderThread to paint the current level's cameras' contents in addition to the current GUI-Frame (which might be an in-game-menu for example). This method does not continue rendering if currently paused.

      • renderGUI

        public void renderGUI()
        Forces the RenderThread to paint the current GUI-Frame and stop rendering the level's cameras. This method does not continue rendering if currently paused.

      • renderUpdate

        public void renderUpdate()
        Re-Initilizes the RenderThread, e.g. after changing screen resolution.

      • renderPause

        public void renderPause()
        Pauses the rendering thread.

      • renderContinue

        public void renderContinue()
        Continues rendering after a renderPause()-call.

      • getImageCopy

        public java.awt.Image getImageCopy(java.lang.String filename)
        Copies an image of the image-hashtable.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the image-file (not path)
        Returns:
        a reference to the Image-instance.

      • getGraphics

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getGraphics(java.lang.String filename)
        Gets an image-reference from the hashmap.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the image file
        Returns:
        a reference to the Image-object or null if not existing.

      • getGraphics

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getGraphics(java.lang.String filename,
                                       java.lang.String levelname)
        Searches for an image in the local level folder first. If not found there it starts searching in the global directory.
        Parameters:
        filename - image filename
        levelname - level name
        Returns:
        instance of the Image

      • getAnimation

        public Animation getAnimation(java.lang.String filename,
                     java.lang.String levelname,
                     int size,
                     int frequence)
        Loads an animation.
        Parameters:
        filename - root-filename of the animation
        levelname - level name
        size - number of pictures used for the animation
        frequence - change frequency of the animation (in miliseconds)
        Returns:
        reference to the animation

      • getTexture

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getTexture(java.lang.String filename)
        Gets an image-reference from the textures-hashmap.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the texture-file
        Returns:
        a reference to the Image-object or null if not existing.

      • getTexture

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getTexture(java.lang.String filename,
                                      java.lang.String levelname)
        Searches for a texture in the local level folder first. If not found there it starts searching in the global directory.
        Parameters:
        filename - texture filename
        levelname - level name
        Returns:
        instance of the texture-Image

      • getTextureAnimation

        public Animation getTextureAnimation(java.lang.String filename,
                            java.lang.String levelname,
                            int size,
                            int frequence)
        Loads a texture animation.
        Parameters:
        filename - root-filename of the texture
        levelname - level name
        size - number of pictures used for the animation
        frequence - change frequency of the animation (in miliseconds)
        Returns:
        reference to the animation
